removals.reasoning: Parentheses around a single unary & expression are redundant in an argument list.
The outer parentheses wrapping the cast expression are redundant; the cast itself (double*)A must keep its parentheses for the type.
As above, remove the redundant outer parentheses around the cast expression.
Outer parentheses around the cast are unnecessary in a function call argument.
Outer parentheses around the cast are unnecessary in a function call argument.
Outer parentheses around the cast are redundant for the call argument.
The outermost parentheses around the cast expression passed to free() are redundant; keep the necessary cast parentheses.
Remove the unnecessary outer parentheses around the cast expression passed to free().
Parentheses around the full array index expression are redundant; the indexing expression can be written without the extra parens.
Remove redundant parentheses around the array index expression for clarity.

The extra outer parentheses and the unnecessary parentheses around the (num + factor) subexpression can be removed while keeping parentheses around the entire numerator to preserve the intended division grouping.
Remove redundant parentheses around the array index on the left-hand side of the assignment.

removals.replacement: B[i * n + j] + (A[k * m + i] * B[k * n + j])
removals.reasoning: The outer parentheses around the sum are unnecessary; multiplication has higher precedence so the inner product does not need outer grouping. Also simplify the indexed expressions (see separate entries).
Remove redundant parentheses around the array index expression inside the product.
Remove redundant parentheses around this array index expression inside the product.
Remove redundant parentheses around the array index on the left-hand side.
Outer parentheses around the multiplication are unnecessary because * has higher precedence than assignment; also simplified the indexed expression (see separate entry).
The outer parentheses wrapping the cast expression passed to memcpy are redundant; keep the cast syntax but drop the extra parens.
Same as above: the outer parentheses around the cast operand are unnecessary.
Remove redundant outer parentheses around cast expression passed to memcpy.
Remove redundant outer parentheses around cast expression passed to memcpy.
Outer parentheses around the cast are redundant in the memcpy call.
Remove redundant outer parentheses around this cast expression.
Remove the unnecessary outer parentheses around the cast.
Same reasoning: outer parentheses are redundant.
Drop unnecessary outer parentheses around the cast passed to memcpy.

Remove the redundant outer parentheses around this cast passed to memcpy.
Parentheses around a single variable used as a function argument are unnecessary and add visual clutter.
Redundant parentheses around the array index expression; the index can be used without the extra parens.
Parentheses around the variable passed to fprintf are redundant.
